intro: Eriostemon spathulifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved eriostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its broad, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
